reviews.sentence: Great suites. The Embassy Suites Downtown is the place to stay if you have business at the Denver Convention Center. Great cook to order breakfast and very courteous front desk staff and service personnel. Cleanliness is certainly a main focus of the entire team with great attention to detail. I highly recommend.

The Perfect Hotel. We had a fabulous stay at this great hotel. It was just perfect. Up to date decor with many free amenities such as buffet breakfast with fabulous bacon great happy hour great staff efficient. This downtown location was great for us sports fans. Walking distance to see the Avalanche hockey game and the Broncos vs Grenbay Go Pack Go. Great shops dining all right here. This has been the quietest hotel in a long time. Our suite you walk right into the front living area with LG LED TV sectional chaise and a desk with work area of course wifi. Then our own wet bar with coffee maker microwave refrigerator small closet very spacious bathroom with tub shower combo a great master bedroom with great lightning king size bed another desk area w wifi of course another fine LG TV and plenty of storage. Inside pool workout room with ample equipment. A nice Social bar. A very accommodating hotel.
Good. Friendly staff great location. Being charged twice for my rooms.

Dependable quality and service. All staff interactions excellent front desk attentive luggage parking guys did a great job. Recommend not staying on the top floor. It was a great view but had some rooftop blower noises I think that interrupted some sleep.

excellent suites great location a tad noisy. would have given it a 5 rating for the helpful staff clean spacious rooms and quality free cooked breakfast. My issue was the noise in the neighboring room that appeared to have been rented to a bunch of teenagers. Security came to quiet them down at 1230am but was in full swing again at 3am. Really nice rooms helpful staff.

Great. There for a conference and the event staff was great. We utilized multiple rooms that needed to be changed more than once temperature in the room changes and AV and the staff was very attentive and ready to help.

completely blown away. 2 families were in town for a wedding a block of 15 rooms were set aside. the embassy suites were simply fabulous from check in to check out the hospitality and service was excellent. 2 hour managers welcoming each night which included drinks and food plus breakfast with omelet station each morningthe service was great and the staff made the difference in so many ways. when we return for a visit this is where we are going to stay. rooms were suites we had a wonderful view of the mountains just so beautiful.
Friendly staff yummy free breakfast nice room Wish internet was free and parking.

Great Stay Lots of Amenities. The hotel is awesome. A few friends and I stayed here as we were looking to ski in Keystone. The hotel has great amenities given the complimentary make to order breakfast and managers reception where you can have free drinks. The rooms were great and spacious. Even received complimentary Wi Fi with my Hilton Honors membership. My friends and I really enjoyed our stay. The only gripe I can mention is with parking which can be expensive and confusing with the many lots around. Nevertheless we settled on metered street parking which was free on Sundays and holidays which we took full advantage of.
Hotel staff was very accommodating. Despite incorrect reservation the staff helped set it right despite having a full hotel.

Pricey Parking. Prepare to pay 40 for parking. The surrounding public parking lots are almost as much. Really not much of a choice. Our room had some trash under the couch and the tv remote did not work. Wi Fi would not connect for us either but we were not therelong enough to complain to the desk about it. Everything else was great.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE. Best place to stay in Denver. I stay every time I am in town for meetings and they are so great to their guests. This last time I arrived late and exhausted. I told the front desk gal that I had a long trip checked into my room. 20 minutes later there was knock at the door. It was room service with a bottle of wine and a note that said I hope you have a relaxing rest of your evening. Corin at the front desk is so sweet. Thank you for always making my trips to Denver easier.

Nice hotel. They have a good variety for breakfast. Rooms are quiet and comforting. do not get lost. The main desk truly is on the 4th floor. Nice location in downtown Denver. Close to lots of different shopping and restaurants.

My husband and I were going to be late to check. in so we had called the front desk to say that we were coming and when we were going to check in. The front said it was okay and to come when we could however when we arrived the manager front desk on staff said the hotel could not accommodate us at the time but we have gotten you a room in an equivalent hotel. it was such BS and not something I wanted to learn about late at night. The equivalent hotel was not equivalent. Not handled well at all.

Better than expected. I was at a conference at the convention center and this hotel which is just across the street was one of the least expensive recommended by the organizers but still not cheap. I stayed for five nights. Before arrival I tried to contact the hotel to get some information but the general policy is that Hilton hotels do not advertise their direct emails I did not want to phone because I was on a different continent 9 time zones away. I finally manages to convince the chat rep on the Hilton site to give me an email to write to and the hotel never replied. This however was my only complaint and it is about Hilton not this particular hotel. When I arrived check in was fast and efficient. When I asked to be on a low floor one of the reasons I emailed I was told that that meant giving up my upgrade to a premium suite. I agreed and I must say that if my room was a standard the premiums must be out of this world. The room I did get was huge a very big bed a kitchenette and a sitting room with sofas desks fridge microwave coffee maker iron plenty of closet and drawer space. Standard wifi worked fine. Breakfast was nice two things some fresh veggies would have been nice and the staff cleared away the tables too fast I went to get something like more coffee and got back to the table to find it cleared away with someone else already seated. there is a mangers reception every evening with free drinks and snacks. All in all wonderful.

Rooms at this embassy suites were top notch. Clean and spacious. Unfortunately staffing levels seemed inadequate to the number of guests so everything happened really slowly from check in to parking to hospitality. Check in was slow getting a drink at the bar was slow trying to take advantage of the happy hour was glacially slow. The final straw was the parking. Because there is no onsite parking and we were uncertain of the neighborhood we accepted the valet parking option. The valets were incredibly slow delaying us but more than 40 minutes on our departure and they were rude to boot. I am docking the hotel one star for generally slow service and one star for the ineptitude and attitude of the valets who may not be under the hotels direct control but whose treatment of their guests reflects poorly on the hotel. Other than the staffing issues great hotel good rooms great location. I will probably look elsewhere the next time I am in Denver though.

Long lines and minimal maid service. This is my first ever review but I felt the need to leave this review since this hotel is not cheap and it was not great. We love Embassy Suites we always try to stay there when possible. We love the convenience of the breakfast and Managers Reception. We also love the pool. This was a huge disappointment. The maid service was horrible. They literally did not bother to fold up the hideaway couch that we half folded in they did not empty the trash and they left out all glasses and did not refresh anything. From what we could tell all they did was make the beds We complained 3 days in a row. It did not make a difference. In the end they took 100 off our bill. Big deal. The lines. The breakfast and the Managers Reception had long lines. Breakfast was not as bad but it was not good. The Managers Reception was a joke. The line was literally into the lobby there was only 1 bartender. Make sure you get 2 drinks when you get to the front because the lines do not improve. Parking was 47 a day. YIKESMOral of the story Save your money and stay somewhere else. We have enjoyed our stays much more at 2 other Embassy Suites in the area.

Great location. 47 a night to park your car. Hip vibe decor was nice. Reception with snacks and free drinks was good. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Mold in the shower grout was a disappointment for a hotel of this scale. Room size was good. Beds ok. Bedding good. Stingy with the cups. Towels were inconsistent. Some were nice. Some were worn with tears. Valet guys were nice. Front desk lady was unhelpful with getting my stay put on my Hilton Honors membership. I did n’t like the lobby on the 4th floor. It makes the elevators especially busy and you have to wait a long time for one. I do n’t think I ’d stay there again especially at that price.

Not impresived for money spent. Easy to find. No bedding for pull out. Two kids and front desk said they only could find 1 pillow and one very thin blanket. Bed uncomfortable. Unable to walk to bathroom with pullout pulled out. Breakfast was good. Pool area had no towels and clorine burned my eyes just walking in.

Do not expect the front desk to assist you. I just love the Embassy Suites it is a hotel of great prestige confort and super hospitality but at the Denver the Front Dest does not fall into any of these categories. They do not listen call back when they say would and have no concern for the guest. I now know why I called the Hotel and spoke to the Front desk Supervisor. when he repeated my concerns back to me never listen to what I said.
